# Sell Membership Add-ons With MemberPress Order Bumps

With the MemberPress Order Bumps add-on, you can upsell additional items alongside your memberships at checkout/registration. You can boost income and simplify sales by offering services, digital downloads, or additional subscriptions as order bumps at checkout.

This document guides you through the setup of MemberPress Order Bumps.  Also, it explains how to add order bumps for your memberships and sell multiple memberships at the same time.

Note: This integration is available to MemberPress Pro plan members. You can upgrade to the Pro plan if you're subscribed to any other plan. To upgrade, click the Change Plan link on your account page.

## Order Bumps Setup

To allow members to purchase additional items at checkout, you should install and activate the MemberPress Order Bumps add-on:

### Primary Membership Add-ons

Once the Order Bumps add-on is activated, you can sell order bumps on the membership checkout page.

Order bumps are separate add-on memberships that can be purchased in a bundle with the primary membership subscription.

The membership for which you would like to set order bumps is called the primary membership.

![MemberPress Order Bumps](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

![Primary Membership Add-ons](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![Primary Membership Add-ons](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mepr-select-order-bumps.png)

Note: Order bumps can be added to the same MemberPress group as the primary membership. However, if the Upgrade path option is enabled for that group, these order bumps will not be available for purchase.  Therefore, although these memberships are added to the primary membership Order Bumps list, they will be hidden at checkout.

![Required Add-on Memberships](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIyNTM5IiBoZWlnaHQ9IjEzMTYiIHZpZXdCb3g9IjAgMCAyNTM5IDEzMTYiPjxyZWN0IHdpZHRoPSIxMDAlIiBoZWlnaHQ9IjEwMCUiIHN0eWxlPSJmaWxsOiNjZmQ0ZGI7ZmlsbC1vcGFjaXR5OiAwLjE7Ii8+PC9zdmc+)![Required Add-on Memberships](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mepr-required-order-bumps.png)

## Purchasing Order Bumps

Once the add-ons are set for the primary membership, they'll be available as purchasable options on the primary membership checkout. All selected add-ons will be sold together with the primary membership as a bundle.

The total price for the bundle will automatically be updated when users select order bumps. The order list will show the primary membership and all selected add-on memberships.

![Bundle Total price](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![Bundle Total price](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/file-Cih2HU7xcu.png)

You can use both recurring and one-time memberships as add-ons. Also, they can be paid or free. However, it’s important to mention that the primary membership can’t be set as free.

Note: MemberPress Coupons will be applied to primary memberships but not to the order bumps. Thus, to apply discounts on any order-bumps memberships, users need to purchase them separately.

### Supported Payment Gateways

Order Bumps are only supported for online payment gateways (Stripe, PayPal, and Authorize.net).

Therefore, the Order Bumps tab will be hidden if only the offline gateway is enabled on the primary membership.

Further, the order bumps availability on the primary membership registration form will depend on two conditions:

Below is the list of available payment gateways and the add-on membership types they support:

Thus, if PayPal is enabled for the primary membership, users can select it as the payment method for their order. In this case, all recurring order bumps will automatically become hidden.

![Supported Payment Gateways](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![Supported Payment Gateways](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/file-QrgRUTnh5h.png)

Furthermore, users can select recurring order bumps and then choose PayPal as the payment method. In this case, the checkout page will display a notification requesting the payment option change.

Also, if you disable online payment gateways for the primary membership, order bumps will become hidden on the checkout form.

Note: Please keep in mind that Order Bumps are not available with the following MemberPress add-ons:– Corporate Accounts– MemberPress GiftingTherefore, order bumps will be hidden on your corporate membership registration forms. Order bumps will also become hidden if the Is this a gift? option is checked on the membership registration form.

### Required Order Bumps

Required order bumps can be used to add one-time fees (e.g., registration fee) or when users must purchase a bundle.

These memberships will be automatically checked and added to the order list.

![Required Order Bumps Checkout](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![Required Order Bumps Checkout](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mepr-required-order-bumps-checkout.png)

Users won't have the option to remove the required order bumps. If they hover over this add-on, MemberPress will notify them that it is required and can't be removed.

Note: Ensure the enabled payment gateways match the required order bumps settings (e.g., enabling Stripe when required add-ons are recurring).

In addition, the required order bump terms will be added to the Terms section of the checkout page.

Note: Required order bumps can't be sold as gifts. When the Gifting add-on is active on your website, the gift checkbox will remain unchecked for memberships with required add-ons.

## Managing Order Bumps Subscriptions

After purchasing a primary membership with order bumps, users will be transferred to your set Thank You page.

![Bundle Thank You Page](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![Bundle Thank You Page](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/file-lmFTFN296x.jpg)

The Thank You page will list all memberships a user has purchased (primary and order bumps).

Users will also receive MemberPress email notifications based on your email settings.

Note: If you enabled the Membership-Specific Welcome Email for your order-bump memberships, these would also be sent. The Send Membership-Specific Welcome Email to User option is available under the Membership Options > Registration tab.

The user will be charged once for the total amount of the bundle, as the first payment for all the memberships is combined.

All these memberships are shown separately on the user’s account and your MemberPress backend, though they share the same transaction.

![Subscriptions To Add-on Memberships](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIxOTIwIiBoZWlnaHQ9Ijk3NSIgdmlld0JveD0iMCAwIDE5MjAgOTc1Ij48cmVjdCB3aWR0aD0iMTAwJSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIxMDAlIiBzdHlsZT0iZmlsbDojY2ZkNGRiO2ZpbGwtb3BhY2l0eTogMC4xOyIvPjwvc3ZnPg==)![Subscriptions To Add-on Memberships](https://memberpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/file-8OdX9mxgip.jpg)

Note: Membership purchases with Order Bumps are multi-item purchases. For this reason, if you're using Stripe as the payment gateway, these transactions will have the mi_xxxxxxx format instead of the standard ch_xxxxxxx format.

For each order, users will receive a combined MemberPress invoice for the entire purchase. Please make sure you're using the latest version of the PDF Invoices add-on with Order Bumps.

Note: In Stripe, subscriptions to order-bumps memberships will show as trials. This is expected behavior. The trials are created for the memberships so they don't start immediately, but rather when their next payment is due. At this point, each membership will be charged as a separate subscription.

Order bumps and the primary membership can have different billing intervals. This means that, for example, one can be set as a monthly membership and another as a yearly membership. Therefore, each subscription will show its own renewal date, and all renewals will be processed individually. Also, each subscription can be canceled separately.

### Refunding Add-on Subscriptions In Stripe

As mentioned, Order Bump purchases are multi-item purchases. Thus, both primary and the order-bump memberships will have a transaction with the mi_xxxxxxx ID format.

These transactions can't be refunded directly. To refund these transactions, follow these steps:
